feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: The daily wage calculator is a payroll feature that automatically computes daily pay deductions for employees taking unpaid leave. It divides the employee's total salary (basic plus allowance) by the actual working days in the month to determine the daily pay rate. The calculation accounts for the leave policy type (calendar days or working days) and automatically deducts public holidays from working days. Upon approval of an unpaid leave request, the system generates an automatic pay deduction reflected on the payroll table. This ensures accurate salary reductions based on the specific leave policy and calendar configuration.

job_to_be_done.content: Calculate and deduct daily pay for employees taking unpaid leave by determining the appropriate salary reduction based on the number of working or calendar days in the month.

Provide a flexible and customizable method for calculating daily wages to determine salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deduction amounts with greater control and compliance with regional labor laws.
Allow super admins to configure and customize leave encashment policies for end-of-service calculations, including selection of salary components and calculation methods.
Calculate and manage unpaid leave deductions on a daily basis to be set off against the employee's monthly pay
Adjust and calculate an employee's salary proportionally based on the actual days worked, affecting their first salary and end-of-service settlement

primary_personas.content: HR personnel and payroll administrators responsible for managing employee leave and salary calculations.
Superadmin, Payroll table managers, and transaction processors who configure and manage daily wage calculations.
Super admins responsible for payroll and HR settings configuration.
Super Admins who configure leave policies and payroll settings

navigation_paths.content: Access the Daily Wage Calculator from Settings → Payroll → Daily Wage Calculation.
Access the Daily Wage Calculator via Settings > Payroll > End of Service eligibility > Configure.
Settings → Leaves → Leave Policies → Add policy → Unpaid leave selection

prerequisites.content: An approved unpaid leave request must exist for the employee before daily pay deduction is calculated and reflected on the payroll table.
Company's public holiday calendar must be set up to exclude weekends and public holidays when using the working days calculation base.
User must have super admin role to access and configure the Daily Wage Calculator settings.
Access to Leave Settings configuration as a Super Admin; ability to add a new leave policy
User must have Super admin role to access and modify salary proration settings

data_inputs_required.content: Employee's total salary (basic salary plus allowance), number of working days in the month, leave policy type (calendar days or working days), and public holidays falling in the month.
Selection of calculation base (calendar days, working days, or custom days) and choice of salary components to include (basic salary, basic salary plus allowances, or allowances only).
Salary components selection (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances), calculation method (calendar days, working days, or custom days), and eligible leave types for encashment configuration.
Selection of calculation method (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances) and day calculation type (Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days)
Selection of calculation basis: custom days, calendar days, or working days

outputs_results.content: Automatic pay deduction associated with the unpaid leave request, calculated daily pay rate, and deduction reflected on the payroll table.
Calculated daily wage rates that are applied to salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deduction calculations.
Customized leave encashment policy configuration that affects end-of-service calculations and determines which salary components and calculation methods apply to leave encashment.
Configured unpaid leave deduction calculation method applied to the leave policy for monthly payroll processing
Updated salary calculations that proportionally adjust employee compensation based on the selected calculation method

procedures.content: Receive unpaid leave request, approve the leave request, determine the applicable leave policy (calendar days or working days), calculate total working days in the month, subtract public holidays from working days to arrive at actual working days, calculate daily pay by dividing salary amount by actual working days, and generate automatic payroll deduction.

Navigate to Settings, select Payroll, choose Daily Wage Calculation, select the desired calculation base (calendar days, working days, or custom days), and choose which salary components to factor into the calculations.

1. Navigate to Settings > Payroll > End of Service eligibility > Configure. 2. Select salary components applicable to leave encashments (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances). 3. Choose calculation method (calendar days, working days, or custom days). 4. Configure individual leave types eligible for encashment in end-of-service calculations.

Navigate to Settings, select Leaves, go to Leave Policies, add a new policy, select Unpaid leave option, choose a calculation method (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances), and select a day calculation type (Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days)

Navigate to Settings > Payroll > Daily wage calculation. Select the required calculation basis (custom days, calendar days, or working days). Save changes. If payroll month is open with existing prorated salary transactions, reject those transactions and resave the proration settings.

rules_limitations_constraints.content: Daily pay is calculated using the formula: Salary Amount (Basic + Allowance) / Number of actual working days in the month. The number of days can be calendar days (e.g., 30 days) if following calendar days leave policy or working days (e.g., 22 days) if following working days leave policy. Public holidays falling in the month must be deducted from the working days to arrive at actual working days used in the calculation.

Calculation can be based on calendar days (actual days in the month), working days (excluding weekends and public holidays), or custom days (flexible, commonly set to 30 days in UAE and KSA to comply with labor law). The Daily Wage Calculation impacts three main areas: Salary proration, Leave encashment, and Unpaid leave deduction.

Salary component options are limited to Basic Only or Basic + Allowances. Calculation method options are calendar days, working days, or custom days. Super admins can configure specific leave types for end-of-service calculations.
Unpaid leave deductions must be calculated daily and set off against the employee's monthly pay; calculation method and day type must be selected when configuring the policy

Changes to salary proration affect all active (unpaid) amounts in the payroll table. When payroll month is open and prorated salary transactions are submitted, Super admin must reject existing transactions before saving new proration settings.

edge_cases_warnings.content: Public holidays must be carefully identified and subtracted from the total working days when calculating daily pay. For example, if 2 days are public holidays in a month with 22 working days, the daily pay calculation uses 20 days instead of 22 days.

Calendar days calculation varies by month (e.g., 31 days in January, 28 days in February), which affects daily wage calculations. Different calculation bases produce different daily wage rates and impact final wage amounts for proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deductions.
Super admins can view which eligible paid leave-type policies will be overwritten by their Daily Wage Calculator configurations to prevent unintended policy changes.

Multiple calculation method options (Basic Only and Basic + Allowances) and day type options (Calendar days, Working days, Custom days) are available; selection impacts how daily deductions are computed

When payroll month is open and prorated salary transactions exist for one or multiple employees, the Super admin must manually reject those transactions before saving changes to salary proration settings.

feature_interactions_dependencies.content: The daily wage calculator interacts with the payroll system to automatically create and reflect pay deductions, and connects with leave management systems to process approved unpaid leave requests and employee record systems.

The Daily Wage Calculator interacts with Payroll settings, public holiday calendar configuration, and leave management systems to calculate accurate daily wage rates for salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deductions.
The Daily Wage Calculator interacts with payroll settings, end-of-service calculations, and leave management systems to customize leave encashment policies.
Interacts with the payroll system to apply daily deductions to monthly employee pay; related to Leave Encashment feature which uses similar configuration flexibility
Interacts with the Payroll system and affects active payroll table transactions and employee compensation calculations

glossary_terms.content: Daily pay: The calculated daily salary amount derived by dividing total salary (basic plus allowance) by actual working days in the month, used to determine deductions for unpaid leave. ; Actual working days: The total number of working days in a month minus public holidays, used as the denominator in daily pay calculation. ; Unpaid leave: Leave taken by an employee without pay, which triggers automatic daily pay deductions based on the calculated daily rate.

Calendar days: the number of days in a given month. Working days: only business days counted, excluding weekends and public holidays set up on the company's public holiday calendar. Custom days: flexible calculation base set according to company policies, commonly 30 days in UAE and KSA to align with labor law requirements.

Leave encashment: The conversion of unused paid leave into monetary compensation. End-of-service: Final payroll calculations when an employee departs. Daily Wage Calculator: Configuration tool for customizing leave encashment policies.

Unpaid leave: Leave taken by an employee without compensation; Daily rate calculation: Method of computing deductions based on daily wage; Leave Policies: Configuration settings that define how leave types are processed; Basic Only: Calculation method using only base salary; Basic + Allowances: Calculation method including base salary and allowances; Calendar days: Day calculation type counting all calendar days; Working days: Day calculation type counting only business days; Custom days: Day calculation type with user-defined parameters

DWC (Daily Wage Calculator): The payroll configuration feature for adjusting salary proration. Salary proration: The proportional adjustment of employee salary based on actual days worked. Calculation bases: The three methods available for proration—custom days, calendar days, or working days.
